title: Audio Player - Comprehensive Usage Examples
description: HTML5 audio player with playlists, multiple styles, and custom controls for podcasts, music, and audio content

examples.name: Simple Podcast Episode Player (Style-1)
examples.description: Basic audio player for single podcast episode with play/pause, volume, and progress bar
examples.visualDescription: Clean player with large play button, purple progress bar, volume control, and episode title below

Aprepeater.title: Episode 42: The Future of Web Design
Aprepeater.author: Design Podcast

examples.useCase: Podcast episodes, audiobook chapters, single audio file playback, blog post audio versions

style1Notes.layout: Vertical layout with play button at top, progress bar, and track info below
style1Notes.playButton: Circular play/pause button with gradient background (bgtype)
style1Notes.bgsize: Button size (60px recommended for touch-friendly 44px minimum)
style1Notes.BorderRadius: 50% for circular button (use equal values for all corners)
style1Notes.SplitText: Text between title and author ('by', '-', '•', etc.)
style1Notes.progress: Horizontal progress bar with handle (TDotColor) and fill (TFillcolor)

audioSourceNotes.AudSource: url (external link) or self (self-hosted WordPress media)
audioSourceNotes.sorurl: External MP3 URL (use for CDN-hosted files, podcasts, SoundCloud links)
audioSourceNotes.sorself: WordPress media library file (use for site-hosted audio)
audioSourceNotes.formats: Supports MP3, OGG, WAV (MP3 most compatible across browsers)
audioSourceNotes.fileSize: Keep under 10MB for web (use 128kbps for speech, 256kbps for music)

examples.name: Music Album Playlist (Style-3)
examples.description: Music player with full playlist, album artwork, and track navigation
examples.visualDescription: Square album artwork on left, playlist on right with clickable tracks, purple active track highlight
examples.useCase: Music albums, mixtapes, compilation playlists, multi-track audio courses, meditation sessions

style3Notes.layout: Horizontal layout: album artwork left, controls center, time display visible
style3Notes.playlist: Below player, clickable tracks with active state highlighting
style3Notes.TTimecolor: Current time and duration text color (00:45 / 03:21)
style3Notes.trackImage: Each track can have unique Imagesource (album artwork changes per track)
style3Notes.TIBorderR: Album artwork border radius (8px subtle, 50% circular)

playlistStyling.PlaBgcolor: Active item background color (highlight currently playing)
playlistStyling.PlPadding: Playlist item padding (12px 16px recommended for touch)
playlistStyling.NormalTop: Top margin for entire playlist (space below player)

examples.name: Minimalist Player with Large Image (Style-5)
examples.description: Clean player design with prominent album artwork and minimal controls
examples.visualDescription: Large square album cover dominates, small circular play button bottom-left, compact progress bar
examples.useCase: Meditation audio, audiobooks with cover art, music singles, feature audio content with visual focus

style5Notes.layout: Image-first design: large album artwork at top, small play button overlayed bottom-left
style5Notes.imageEmphasis: Album artwork is primary visual element (400x400px typical)
style5Notes.playButtonPosition: Floating circular button on image (absolute positioned bottom-left)
style5Notes.bgsize: Smaller button for unobtrusive design (50px, can go 40-60px)
style5Notes.transparency: Use rgba() for bgtype to blend with image (0.95 opacity recommended)
style5Notes.TIBorderR: Large border radius for modern aesthetic (12px)
style5Notes.TIBoxShadow: Strong shadow for image depth (vertical: 8, blur: 24)
style5Notes.PBMargin: Top margin separates image from track info below

examples.name: Horizontal Compact Player (Style-6)
examples.description: Space-efficient horizontal player for sidebar or narrow containers
examples.visualDescription: All controls in single row: small play button, track info, progress bar, volume - all horizontal
examples.useCase: Sidebar audio players, footer persistent players, narrow widget areas, background music controls

style6Notes.layout: All-horizontal layout: every element in single row for space efficiency
style6Notes.compactDesign: Smaller icons and text for narrow spaces (14px icons, 12-14px text)
style6Notes.bgsize: Small play button (40px) to fit horizontal layout
style6Notes.MaxWidth: 100% to fill container width (responsive to parent)
style6Notes.borderOnly: bgtype: 0 with BackgroundType border creates outline button

examples.name: Full-Width Player with Background Blur (Style-8)
examples.description: Immersive player with blurred album artwork background and centered controls
examples.visualDescription: Album artwork fills background with blur effect, white text overlay, large centered play button
examples.useCase: Hero audio players, featured music tracks, immersive listening experiences, artist showcases

style8Notes.backgroundImage: Album artwork used as full-width background (Imagesource required)
style8Notes.PBGCSSFilters: CSS filters applied to background image for blur/darkness effect
style8Notes.blur: Blur amount in pixels (10-30px, 20px recommended for readability)
style8Notes.brightness: Darken background (50-80%, 70% recommended for white text contrast)
style8Notes.saturate: Boost color saturation (100-150%, 120% for vivid effect)
style8Notes.whiteText: All text white/rgba white for contrast on dark background
style8Notes.largeControls: Larger play button (90px) and text (24px) for hero presentation
style8Notes.PBPadding: Large padding (60px 40px) for spacious, premium feel
style8Notes.transparency: Use rgba() for overlays (bgtype, PlBgType) to show background
style8Notes.performance: CSS blur is GPU-intensive, test on lower-end devices

cssFiltersGuide.hue: 0-360 degrees (color shift, rarely used for backgrounds)
cssFiltersGuide.recommended: blur: 20, brightness: 70, saturate: 120 for legible white text

examples.name: Card-Style Player with Hover Controls (Style-9)
examples.description: Modern card design with controls appearing on hover, background image card
examples.visualDescription: Card with background image, controls hidden until hover, smooth fade-in effect
examples.useCase: Music cards in grids, featured audio content, interactive audio galleries, hover-reveal players

style9Notes.hoverReveal: Controls hidden by default, appear on card hover (CSS opacity transition)
style9Notes.CBGcolor: Controls bar background color (overlays bottom of image)
style9Notes.CBGRadiuss9: Controls bar border radius (bottom-left and bottom-right for overlay effect)
style9Notes.cardLayout: Image fills card, controls overlay at bottom on hover
style9Notes.interaction: Hover-based UI, not ideal for touch devices (controls always visible on mobile)
style9Notes.imageRequired: Imagesource required for background (card design relies on image)
style9Notes.TIBorderR: Card border radius (12px modern, 0px for sharp edges)
style9Notes.accessibility: Consider always-visible controls alternative for keyboard/touch users

examples.name: Colorful Playlist with Track Images (Style-2)
examples.description: Vibrant player with color accents, individual track thumbnails in playlist
examples.visualDescription: Bright purple accents, playlist with small thumbnail images per track, modern typography
examples.useCase: Audio courses with chapters, tutorial series, lesson playlists, multi-part presentations

style2Notes.thumbnails: Each track can have unique Imagesource (lesson thumbnails, episode artwork)
style2Notes.courseStructure: Ideal for sequential audio content (courses, tutorials, series)
style2Notes.visualCues: Track images help identify content at a glance
style2Notes.gradient: Gradient play button adds visual interest (bgtype with bgGradient)
style2Notes.volumeControl: Visible volume slider (VolScolor, VolSBgColor for styling)

examples.name: Self-Hosted Audio with Custom Typography (Style-7)
examples.description: Player for self-hosted audio files with refined typography and custom styling
examples.visualDescription: Clean player with serif typography, muted colors, professional presentation for voice content
examples.useCase: Corporate announcements, voice memos, internal communications, professional voice content

style7Notes.selfHosted: AudSource: 'self' with sorself for WordPress media library files
style7Notes.sorself: WordPress attachment with url (full path) and Id (attachment ID)
style7Notes.uploadPath: Self-hosted files in /wp-content/uploads/ (managed via WP media library)
style7Notes.TTWidth: Progress bar width as percentage (70% leaves room for controls)
style7Notes.typography: Serif fonts work well for voice/speech content (SongFont, AuthorFont)
style7Notes.audioFormat: MP3 most compatible, OGG/WAV alternatives (browsers auto-fallback)

selfHostedNotes.advantages: Full control, privacy, no third-party dependencies, works offline
selfHostedNotes.disadvantages: Uses server bandwidth, increases backup size, slower than CDN
selfHostedNotes.fileSize: Compress audio: 64kbps mono for speech, 128kbps stereo for music
selfHostedNotes.optimization: Use MP3 with 128kbps for good quality/size balance (<10MB recommended)
selfHostedNotes.mediaLibrary: Upload via WordPress Media Library, use sorself.Id for attachment ID
selfHostedNotes.bandwidth: Monitor server bandwidth usage for high-traffic sites (consider CDN for large files)

singleTrack.description: Simple player for one audio file

attributes.Aprepeater: Array with multiple tracks (_key, title, author, sorurl, Imagesource)

immersive.description: Full-width player with background image blur

validationRules.block_id: Required, unique identifier for the block instance
validationRules.Aprepeater: Required, array of track objects with _key (unique), title, author
validationRules.Aprepeater._key: Required for each track, must be unique (React rendering)
validationRules.Aprepeater.sorurl: Required if AudSource is 'url', must have url property with MP3 link
validationRules.Aprepeater.sorself: Required if AudSource is 'self', must have url and Id from WP media library
validationRules.MaxWidth: Responsive object, controls player width (600px typical for single track, 800px for playlist)
validationRules.bgsize: Responsive object, play/pause button size (50-70px recommended, minimum 44px for touch)
validationRules.BorderRadius: Use 50% for all corners to create circular play button

warnings: ⚠️ AudSource: 'url' requires sorurl with valid MP3 URL, 'self' requires sorself with WP media attachment
⚠️ Aprepeater: Each track MUST have unique _key value (React rendering breaks with duplicates)
⚠️ sorurl.url: Must be direct link to MP3 file (not HTML page), HTTPS recommended for security
⚠️ sorself: Use WordPress media library uploader to get correct url and Id (don't manually construct paths)
⚠️ bgsize: Minimum 44x44px for touch targets (WCAG 2.5.5), 50-70px recommended
⚠️ BorderRadius: Set all 4 corners to 50% for circular button (not just top/left)
⚠️ PBGCSSFilters: Only works with style-8, requires Imagesource for background image
⚠️ Style-9: Hover-based controls not ideal for touch devices (controls always visible on mobile)
⚠️ Imagesource: Optional for most styles, required for style-8 (background) and style-9 (card)
⚠️ ImageSize: Use 'thumbnail' (150px), 'medium' (300px), or 'large' (1024px) - not 'full' for performance
⚠️ File size: Keep MP3 files under 10MB for web (compress to 128kbps for music, 64kbps for speech)
⚠️ Self-hosted: Uses server bandwidth (monitor usage, consider CDN for high-traffic sites)
⚠️ Playlist: With 10+ tracks, consider lazy loading or pagination (performance impact)
⚠️ Volume slider: Some mobile browsers ignore volume controls (system volume only)
⚠️ Autoplay: Browsers block autoplay without user interaction (don't rely on autoplay)
⚠️ TTWidth: Percentage value for progress bar width (50-90%, ensure room for controls)
commonMistakes: ❌ Forgetting to set unique _key values in Aprepeater (causes React 'key prop' warnings)
❌ Using AudSource: 'url' without setting sorurl.url (audio won't load)
❌ Using AudSource: 'self' without uploading file to WordPress media library first
❌ Setting BorderRadius to only 1 corner (use all 4 corners at 50% for circular button)
❌ Using bgsize smaller than 44px (fails WCAG touch target minimum)
❌ Setting DefaultVolume to 0.7 instead of 70 (expects integer 0-100, not decimal)
❌ Using sorurl.url with HTML page instead of direct MP3 file (player won't load)
❌ Uploading 20MB uncompressed audio files (slow page load, high bandwidth usage)
❌ Using style-8 without Imagesource (background blur requires image)
❌ Using ImageSize: 'full' for album artwork (loads 4000px+ images, use 'medium' or 'large')
❌ Mixing up sorurl (external URL object) and sorself (WP media object) - use correct one for AudSource
❌ Not testing on mobile (volume controls may not work, hover effects don't translate)
❌ Using HTTP URLs in sorurl.url (browsers block mixed content on HTTPS sites)
❌ Setting TTWidth to 100% (no room for volume/playlist controls)
❌ Creating playlist with 50+ tracks without pagination (slow rendering, bad UX)
❌ Using PBGCSSFilters with styles other than style-8 (attribute only applies to style-8)
bestPractices: ✅ Always set unique _key for each track in Aprepeater (use index: '0', '1', '2' or UUIDs)
✅ Use AudSource: 'url' with CDN-hosted MP3s for better performance and bandwidth savings
✅ Compress audio files: 128kbps for music, 64kbps mono for speech (balance quality/size)
✅ Set DefaultVolume to 70-80 for comfortable listening (not too loud, not too quiet)
✅ Use bgsize: 60-70px for desktop, ensure minimum 44px for mobile touch targets
✅ Set BorderRadius to 50% on all 4 corners for perfect circular play button
✅ Use ImageSize: 'medium' (300px) or 'large' (1024px) for album artwork (not 'full')
✅ Provide Imagesource for all tracks in playlist (visual distinction between tracks)
✅ Use style-1 or style-3 for podcasts/courses (clear track listing)
✅ Use style-5 or style-8 for featured music (image-first immersive design)
✅ Use style-6 for sidebars/widgets (horizontal compact layout)
✅ Use style-9 for music cards in grids (hover-reveal controls)
✅ Set MaxWidth to 600px for single track, 800px for playlists (optimal readability)
✅ Use descriptive title and author text (improves accessibility for screen readers)
✅ Test on mobile devices (volume controls, touch targets, responsive sizing)
✅ Use HTTPS URLs for sorurl.url (avoid mixed content warnings)
✅ Keep playlists to 5-10 tracks (better UX, faster loading)
✅ Use SplitText: 'by' for music, '-' for podcasts, '•' for minimalist design
✅ Match player colors to site branding (TitleColor, PlayPausecolor, TFillcolor)
✅ Add subtle shadows for depth (PBGboxshadow, TIBoxShadow with low opacity)
✅ Use responsive typography (SongFont, AuthorFont with md/sm/xs breakpoints)
✅ Test with various audio durations (30s clips vs 60min podcasts)
✅ Provide clear track titles (not 'Track 1', use descriptive names)
✅ For style-8, use brightness: 70 and blur: 20 for optimal white text contrast

accessibilityNotes.touchTargets: Play/pause button minimum 44×44px (WCAG 2.5.5), use bgsize: {md: '50', unit: 'px'} or larger
accessibilityNotes.keyboardControls: HTML5 audio has native keyboard controls (space = play/pause, arrows = seek)
accessibilityNotes.screenReaders: Track title and author announced automatically, use descriptive text
accessibilityNotes.colorContrast: Ensure 4.5:1 contrast ratio for TitleColor and Authorcolor against PlBgType background
accessibilityNotes.volumeControls: Not all devices support volume controls (iOS uses system volume only)
accessibilityNotes.progressBar: Seekable with keyboard (arrow keys) and mouse/touch drag
accessibilityNotes.playlistNavigation: Playlist items keyboard accessible (Tab to navigate, Enter to play)
accessibilityNotes.hoverStates: Style-9 hover controls problematic for keyboard/touch (consider always-visible alternative)
accessibilityNotes.audioDescription: For video content with audio, provide text transcripts
accessibilityNotes.autoplay: Don't rely on autoplay (browsers block without user interaction)

performanceConsiderations.fileSize: Keep MP3 files under 10MB (compress to 128kbps music, 64kbps speech)
performanceConsiderations.compression: Use VBR (variable bitrate) encoding for best quality/size balance
performanceConsiderations.streaming: HTML5 audio streams progressively (doesn't wait for full download)
performanceConsiderations.cdn: Host large audio files on CDN (faster delivery, saves server bandwidth)
performanceConsiderations.selfHosted: Self-hosted audio uses your server bandwidth (monitor usage)
performanceConsiderations.imageOptimization: Compress album artwork to <100KB (use ImageSize: 'medium' or 'large', not 'full')
performanceConsiderations.playlistLength: Limit to 10-15 tracks per player (use multiple players or pagination for more)
performanceConsiderations.cssFilters: PBGCSSFilters (blur) is GPU-intensive (test on lower-end devices)
performanceConsiderations.lazyLoading: Consider lazy loading playlist tracks (load audio on click, not page load)
performanceConsiderations.caching: Enable browser caching for audio files (set Cache-Control: max-age=31536000)
performanceConsiderations.formats: MP3 is universally supported, no need for OGG/WAV fallbacks in modern browsers
performanceConsiderations.preload: HTML5 audio preload='metadata' (loads duration/info, not full file)

troubleshooting.audioNotPlaying: Check sorurl.url is direct MP3 link (not HTML page), verify HTTPS on HTTPS sites
troubleshooting.volumeNotWorking: iOS/mobile devices use system volume (player volume controls ignored)
troubleshooting.imageNotShowing: Verify Imagesource.url valid, check ImageSize exists in WordPress media settings
troubleshooting.playlistNotClickable: Ensure Apstyle supports playlists (styles 1, 3, 4, 5, 6 have playlist UI)
troubleshooting.playButtonNotCircular: Set BorderRadius to 50% on ALL 4 corners (top, right, bottom, left)
troubleshooting.controlsNotHovering: Style-9 only: check IconColor, CBGcolor set, works on desktop only
troubleshooting.backgroundBlurNotWorking: Style-8 only: verify PBGCSSFilters.openFilter: true, Imagesource set
troubleshooting.selfHostedNotLoading: Upload file via WP Media Library, use sorself.Id (attachment ID) and url (full path)
troubleshooting.progressBarNotSeeking: Check TFillcolor, Trackcolor, TDotColor set (required for visual feedback)
troubleshooting.playlistItemsDuplicate: Set unique _key values for each Aprepeater item ('0', '1', '2', etc.)
troubleshooting.mixedContentError: Use HTTPS URLs in sorurl.url (HTTP blocked on HTTPS sites)
troubleshooting.playerNotResponsive: Set responsive values for SongFont, AuthorFont, bgsize, MaxWidth (md/sm/xs)
troubleshooting.volumeSliderMissing: Styles 1-6 have volume controls (7, 8, 9 may hide or omit volume UI)
troubleshooting.autoplayBlocked: Browsers block autoplay without user interaction (user must click play first)

integrationExamples.description: Dynamically populate player from ACF podcast episode custom fields
Replace SoundCloud embeds with styled audio player (faster, more control)
Pause other players when one starts playing (only one plays at a time)
Track play events and listening duration in Google Analytics
